title: NAIDOC week in Sydney at Laing O'Rourke
author: WORK180
body:
Laing O’Rourke project teams across the country have spent this week acknowledging NAIDOC Week and celebrating the history, culture and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.  

This year’s theme, ‘Because of Her, We Can” honours the essential role women have played - and continue to play - as active and significant role models at the community, local, state and national levels.

We were extremely lucky to be joined by Daniel Phillips – Managing Director of New Start – and Yidaki Yulugi, who performed a number of traditional songs and dances for our staff earlier this week in our North Sydney office. Check out the video for yourself:


2018 NAIDOC Week from Laing O'Rourke on Vimeo.


About Laing O'Rourke

Laing O'Rourke is an Endorsed Employer for Women. Their Managing Director Cathal O'Rourke is a WGEA Pay Equity Ambassador. Named twice as Australia’s Top 10 most innovative businesses, Laing O’Rourke offers generous paid parental leave (26 Weeks), competitive pay, flexible work arrangements and career progression working on exciting projects. Building the future pipeline of women in STEM is also a priority. Their “Inspiring STEM+” is a school program designed to encourage more girls into STEM courses at university and ultimately careers in construction and engineering.

About WORK180

WORK180 is an international jobs network that connects smart businesses with the very best female talent. We pre-screen every employer on our jobs board to see where they stand on pay equity, flexible working, paid parental leave, equal opportunities and a range of other criteria. We also take into account diversity initiatives focusing on age, ability, ethnicity and sexual orientation.

The information we uncover is made public on our website, so that everyone knows what to expect from each employer before applying for a job. We continually review and evolve our pre-screening criteria to ensure workplaces are fair and equal for everyone.
